poem:
### Diocese in Bankruptcy

In the quiet pews,  
whispers of old sins echo,  
as silver crosses gleam  
under a stained glass sun.  
In Alexandria, debts unpaid—  
not of slant light,  
but trust, shattered.  
Amid whispered prayers,  
papers shuffle like autumn leaves,  
seeking solace  
in the language of courts,  
a fragile amen.
